page.title: 08Wakefield Trinity R.L.F.C.
page.content: {Wakefield Trinity}was formed in 1895. Their ground is at Belle Vue which is in our "D"block.Their nickname is the{ {Dreadnoughts}.In the 1960's when one thought of sport in Wakefield,one automatically thought of{Trinity.}They won the {Challenge Cup} three years in succession from 1959/60 to 1962/3. Nowadays they are a struggling 2nd Division Club. Attendances average 1500. Their most famous player was undoubtedly Neil Fox who holds the Club record of 163 goals in a season. He also holds the points record of 407 in a season. Trinity's record attendance is 37,906 for a Cup-tie between Leeds and Huddersfield. Trinity's own record attendance is 28,254 for a Cup-tie against Wigan. They start the new season in September hoping for promotion to Div. 1.
